alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 11:27PM MST until August 20 at 4:30AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Running washes overflowing rural roads. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1127 PM MST, gauge reports indicated runoff continuing heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Delaney Wash. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Delaney Wash is the most likely place to experience flooding. Additional washes include... Dead Horse Wash, Pump Mine Wash, Centennial Wash, Tiger Wash, Winters Wash, Woodchopper Wash, Old Camp Wash, Beer Bottle Wash, Coyote Wash and Jackrabbit Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tonopah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
